intro: Lilium martagon subsp. pilosiusculum, commonly known as the velvet lily, is a rare and ornamental member of the Liliaceae family. It is characterized by its distinctive, upward-curving, recurved petals that are often tinged with red or purple at the base. The plant typically grows in woodland areas and is native to regions of Europe and western Asia. Its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, producing a striking display of pink to white hues. The subspecies is noted for its dense, hairy foliage, which gives it its common name and contributes to its unique botanical appearance.
